page.title: 12WILLIAM PARKER SCHOOL
page.content: Half the teenage male population of Hastings receive their education in this all boys school. There are 80 teachers and over 1,400 pupils. All pupils wear a uniform, consisting of a blue blazer which has a school badge, grey trousers, a school tie and dark shoes. The curriculum incluses many subjects including English, Mathematics, Science and Technology, French and the Humanities. At the end of the 5th year they sit exams which help them to get jobs. Many stay on at school to improve their qualifications. The better pupils specialise in 3 subjects which they study till they are 18. The exam then will give them qualifications for higher education or employment in a profession.
